result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Daniel S. Chenoweth was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Daniel S. Chenoweth, appeared in custody and with Attorney Carmen L. Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Case Worker Glorielsie Velazquez is present in court stating a conditional release plan will be submitted to the court within 3 weeks as there will be a group home available in Racine.   Hearing adj. to November 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carmen Lassiter.  Clerk: PT
Court has reviewed the doctors report and will not authorize DE's release until an appropriate outpatient setting has been established.  Atty Lassiter states she received the report this morning and has not followed up on this matter.  Court instructs Atty Lassiter to make arrangements for someone to appear from the community support program at the next hearing and they may appear by phone.  Atty Lassiter requests she be allowed to send a copy of the report to Racine Co. Circuit Court and court approves request.  Hearing adjourned to 10/29/15 at 8:50 AM.
